title: American_Top_40_1984_February_4th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

Casey tells about the only person to ever hit the top 40 who was also a member of the United States Congress.

In chart history, only two active groups have ever had two of their members put hits in the top 40 at the same time. One was Crosby, Stills, Nash, & Young. The other group has two of it's members in THIS countdown.

Casey tells how the Three Stooges got their star on the Holloywood Walk-Of-Fame.

Casey answers the question, "What male singer and what female singer have had the most top 40 hits with movie songs?" The female singer is in this countdown.

Casey remembers the great Jackie Wilson.
